instructions.title: SURFACE PREPARATION
instructions.data: Scrape off all loose, scaling, flaking, and peeling paint manually or by using BOYSEN®® Paint and Varnish Remover B‑141, as necessary. Wash surfaces clean and completely remove chemical residue. Let it dry. For repainting concrete with chalky old paint, use BOYSEN®® Chalk Blocker™ B‑7304 as surface conditioner. In case of mildew infestation, treat with a bleach solution (1:3, laundry bleach to water, respectively) by swabbing or brushing. To ensure proper treatment, let stand for 24 hours before cleaning off residue. Let dry. Surface to be repainted should be clean and dry, free from oil, grease, dust and dirt, and all possible contaminants.

instructions.title: PAINTING SCHEDULE
instructions.data: Primer (resulting bare substrate): BOYSEN®® Permacoat™ Flat Latex B‑701 Putty: BOYSEN®® Masonry Putty B‑7311 Colored Basecoat (2 coats): BOYSEN®® Permacoat™ Flat Latex (any desired plant-mixed color) Decorative Topcoat: Using a DECORe brush, apply Sandino in light, crisscrossing strokes, spreading it as evenly as possible. Avoid lap marks by applying the product in sections. Leave a small gap in between the sections then just spot apply Sandino on the gaps right after to even it out.

instructions.title: NOTES
instructions.data: DECORe Sandino should only be applied as a decorative finish on surfaces that are properly painted with a flat topcoat. For best results, the color of the flat topcoat should complement the effect of Sandino Gold or Sandino Silver. Only use the provided BOYSEN®® DECORe™ Brush. The desired finish may not be achieved if a different material is used.
